text: In my previous full-time work position at one product startup, we had a flat organizational structure with a unique twist. People across different teams were encouraged to participate in the decision making process and even move from one role to another to push the company forward. Although this system has its flaws, it gets one thing right: there are no “promotions” or “demotions” (at least not in a traditional sense) because this implies one role being less important from another. Managers are not your superiors _per se;_ their job description implies organizing workloads, establishing processes, and managing employees - just like content writers' have their own responsibilities (writing, optimizing, and publishing content, for instance). Here's a thought: maybe promotions shouldn't be exclusively tied to moving into a management role.
